column3: You need to squash the 2 commits into one and I still see the indentation issue?\n
ACK, if you squash the commits together.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/d0307c46f4013f7d60e505e3a1c737ebd6788203 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

This fix is not correct. It indeed looks like there is currently a fd leak when `file && GetFilesize(file) < 10 * 1000000`, but your change would also cause a fclose in the case that file == NULL (when the debug log cannot be opened; resulting in a segmentation fault).\n

IMHO it would be sufficient to write:
`else if (file)`

And please also check your indentation below!
i have done the same (IMHO) and fixed the indentation issue as well\n
